Given the input sentence, please extract the subject and object containing a certain relation in the sentence according to the following relation types, in the format of "relation1: word1, word2; relation2: word3, word4". Relations include: product/material produced; manufacturer; distributed by; industry; position held; original broadcaster; owned by; founded by; distribution format; headquarters location; stock exchange; currency; parent organization; chief executive officer; director/manager; owner of; operator; member of; employer; chairperson; platform; subsidiary; legal form; publisher; developer; brand; business division; location of formation; creator.

The subject and object containing a certain relation in the sentence can be extracted by identifying the words that are related to the given relation type. For example, if the relation type is "product/material produced", the subject and object would be the words that indicate the product or material that was produced.

Here are some examples of how to extract the subject and object for different relation types:

- product/material produced: The subject would be the name of the product or material, and the object would be the name of the company or person that produced it. For example, if the sentence is "Apple produced the iPhone", the subject is "iPhone" and the object is "Apple".
- manufacturer: The subject would be the name of the company that is manufacturing something, and the object would be the name of the product that is being manufactured. For example, if the sentence is "Samsung is the manufacturer of the Galaxy S21", the subject is "Samsung" and the object is "Galaxy S21".
- distributed by: The subject would be the name of the company or person that is distributing something, and the object would be the name of the product that is being distributed. For example, if the sentence is "Amazon is distributing the Kindle e-reader", the subject is "Amazon" and the object is "Kindle e-reader".
- industry: The subject would be the name of the industry, and the object would be the name of the company or person that is part of that industry. For example, if the sentence is "Tech is an industry that includes Apple and Google", the subject is "Tech" and the object is "Apple and Google".
- position held: The subject would be the name of the person, and the object would be the name of the position that they held. For example, if the sentence is "Steve Jobs was the CEO of Apple", the subject is "Steve Jobs" and the object is "CEO of Apple".
- original broadcaster: The subject would be the name of the show or program, and the object would be the name of the network or channel that broadcasted it. For example, if the sentence is "Fox News is the original broadcaster of The Five", the subject is "The Five" and the object is "Fox News".
- owned by: The subject would be the name of the company or person that owns something, and the object would be the name of the thing that is being owned. For example, if the sentence is "Disney is owned by The Walt Disney Company", the subject is "Disney" and the object is "The Walt Disney Company".
- founded by: The subject would be the name of the company or organization, and the object would be the name of the person or group that founded it. For example, if the sentence is "Microsoft was founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen", the subject is "Microsoft" and the object is "Bill Gates and Paul Allen".
- distribution format: The subject would be the name of the format, and the object would be the name of the company or person that is distributing it. For example, if the sentence is "Netflix is the company that distributes its content in streaming format", the subject is "streaming format" and the object is "Netflix".
- headquarters location: The subject would be the name of the company or organization, and the object would be the name of the location of its headquarters. For example, if the sentence is "Apple's headquarters are located in Cupertino, California", the subject is "Apple" and the object is "Cupertino, California".
- stock exchange: The subject would be the name of the company or organization, and the object would be the name of the stock exchange where its shares are traded. For example, if the sentence is "Amazon's stock is traded on the NASDAQ stock exchange", the subject is "Amazon" and the object is "NASDAQ stock exchange".
- currency: The subject would be the name of the currency, and the object would be the name of the country or region where it is used. For example, if the sentence is "The currency used in Japan is the Japanese yen", the subject is "Japanese yen" and the object is "Japan".
- parent organization: The subject would be the name of the company or organization, and the object would be the name of the parent company
